headline: Why Apple may be due for a stronger-than-usual iPhone update cycle
summary: Apple (AAPL) launches its iOS 18.2 update today. Some features in the update include ChatGPT integration into Siri and creating your own emojis. Creative Strategies CEO and Principal Analyst Ben Bajarin sits down with Asking for a Trend Anchor Josh Lipton to talk about how the new iOS update could impact iPhone demands and sales. "I think the super cycle term gets thrown around," says Bajarin. "I mean, I'm just still of the strong conviction that hardware changes, design changes drive those super cycles, not software. I do still think this is going to be a stronger-than-normal upgrade cycle only because we've known that this is an aging base." Bajarin went out to talk about the partnership between Apple and Sam Altman's OpenAI, the company that develops ChatGPT. "I think OpenAI, they're not Google. In no way, shape, or form are they brand-recognized or used as much as Google," says Bajarin. "So you could see the differences of this deal between a Google for search and ChatGPT and OpenAI for other features." Watch the video above to hear Bajarin's full take on Apple's iOS update. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Daniel A. Nelson

headline: Apple iOS 18.2 brings ChatGPT to iPhone users, OpenAI releases Sora
summary: Apple launches iOS 18.2 bringing Apple Intelligence features to new iPhone models, including ChatGPT integration, Genmoji, Image Playground, and Visual Intelligence. In other AI news, ChatGPT maker OpenAI unveils its AI video generation tool, Sora. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley joins Market Domination Host Julie Hyman to break down the latest in the tech space. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Apple Stock Today: A Rise In Volatility Would Generate Profits In This Options Trade
summary: Apple is currently trading with a very low implied volatility (IV) rank.  This means options are cheap compared to the last 12 months.  Similar to this idea from a few weeks ago on Palantir Technologies, Apple stock could either continue its upward momentum, or suffer a pullback.

headline: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to hyper-charge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth used by more than 92% of Fortune 500 companies. That growth has propelled OpenAI itself into becoming one of the most-hyped companies in recent memory. And its latest partnership with Apple for its upcoming generative AI offering, Apple Intelligence, has

headline: Mag 7 'not critical' for market success in 2025: Strategist
summary: While Bloomberg Intelligence is forecasting the Magnificent Seven's earnings growth — Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — to drop from 2024's 34% to 18% in 2025, will the group of tech stocks be as pivotal for the S&P 500 (^GSPC) in the new year? "They're obviously important for the market, but they're not critical for the market's success. And we see signs that earnings growth is set to broaden out as we head into 2025," J.P. Morgan Private Bank US Head of Investment Strategy Jake Manoukian tells Seana Smith and Brad Smith on the Morning Brief. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. ]This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Omnicom to Acquire Interpublic in Deal That Will Reshape Advertising Industry
summary: Omnicom  Group will acquire  Interpublic Group  in a deal that will create the world’s largest advertising business, the companies confirmed Monday.  A combined entity would have net revenue of more than $20 billion, based on 2023 figures for each company, and include storied ad agencies such as TBWA Worldwide and McCann Worldgroup.  The Wall Street Journal reported Sunday that the companies were in advanced merger talks.

The Wall Street Journal reported Sunday that the companies were in advanced merger talks.

headline: Mag 7's profit growth forecasted to slow in 2025: Bloomberg
summary: As the S&P 500's (^GSPC) Magnificent Seven — Meta Platforms (META) Microsoft (MSFT) Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — could see its profit growth slow from 34% to 18% in 2025, Bloomberg Intelligence reports the healthcare sector could take the lead. Yahoo Finance host Madison Mills joins the Morning Brief to break down Bloomberg Intelligence's latest earnings growth estimates. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Apple announces Apple Retail expansion in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
summary: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, December 09, 2024--Apple® today announced plans to expand in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, starting with the launch of the Apple Store® online in summer 2025. The online store will bring customers across Saudi Arabia new ways to shop Apple’s full range of products, with exceptional service and support directly from Apple in Arabic for the very first time.
